availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Peggy Hunts McClanahan in Madison County, Kentucky, on November 12, 1801. Married to Amelia Irvine McClanahan in Madison County on September 19, 1811. Father of Elizabeth McClanahan Stone, Margaret McClanahan Turner, Amelia McClanahan Stonestreet, Irvine McClanahan, Thomas Ezekiel McClanahan, Anna McClanahan, and Willis McClanahan. Resident in Madison County in 1820. Owned five enslaved persons in Madison County in 1820. Resident in Madison County in 1830. Owned nine enslaved persons in Madison County in 1830. Merchant in Madison County in 1850. Owned ten enslaved persons in Madison County in 1850.
